abstract: Britain formally withdrew from the European Union at 11 p.m. on Friday, after nearly half a century of membership.
lead_paragraph: At 11 p.m. — midnight in Brussels and 6 p.m. in New York — Britain officially left the European Union. Flags lined Parliament Square and the Mall, the ceremonial avenue leading to Buckingham Palace, and government buildings were lit up in the red, white and blue of the Union Jack.
